alert.note: Alert for Inland Dixie; Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lafayette and north central Dixie Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Steinhatchee, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayo, San Pedro Junction and Cooks Hammock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
